definition: to look after (elderly parents)/to serve/to support
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
to raise (animals)/to bring up (children)/to keep (pets)/to support/to give birth

sentences.english: There will be more senior citizens to be supported by fewer young people.
sentences.chinese: 更多的老人必须由更少的年轻人奉养。

sentences.english: So he would build a little house and care for her there.
sentences.chinese: 所以他盖了一座小屋，在那里奉养母亲。

sentences.english: Wait on them day and night, without ever leaving their bedside.
sentences.chinese: 非论日间夜晚都奉养着，不分开怙恃的床边。

sentences.english: We should serve all our uncles as respectfully as we serve our own fathers.
sentences.chinese: 奉养诸位伯叔母舅，宛如奉养本身的父亲一样敬重。

sentences.english: We should serve all our uncles as respectfully as we serve our own fathers.
sentences.chinese: 奉养诸位伯叔母舅，宛如奉养本身的父亲一样敬重。

definition: to support/to provide support for/to maintain
to show filial respect/to give presents (to one's elders or superiors)/to support one's aged parents
to look after one's aged parents and arrange proper burial after they die
to do one's filial duty
to supply/to provide for one's elders/to support one's parents
to make offerings (to the Gods)
to wait upon/to serve/to attend to sb's needs
descendant
elder brother and his wife
parents
father/old man/venerable sir
to pay one's last respects
to observe mourning for one's parents
to foster/to bring up/to raise
to nurture/to raise/to foster/to tend
filial piety (Confucian virtue)/to be a good son or daughter
unfilial
